conclusion: Need to calculate the area under the v-t graph to determine distance fallen.
Velocity starts at 0 and increases to a peak at 10 seconds; peak velocity is 20 m/s.
Area under the v-t graph between 0 and 10 seconds represents the distance fallen.
Approximate the area under the curve by comparing it to a triangle.
Draw a straight line from (0,0) to (10,20) to form a triangle with base 10 seconds and height 20 m/s.
Calculate area of triangle: 1/2 * base * height = 100 meters.
Actual curve is below the straight line, so actual area is less than 100 meters.
Distance fallen during 0 to 10 seconds is less than 100 meters.
